Posts.Content: Newfie11 is right, green discharge is very common and usually means nothing. The fact that it is coming from both sides is actually reassuring. You are wise to get a mammogram, that's always a good idea. But don't stress too much.
Posts.Title: Green discharge

Posts.Content: Although it is totally stressful, I agree with others that this is a common occurence in centers where the radiologist doesn't read films immediately, or where on closer inspection wants an extra picture (or 2!) to clarify things. Insist on a reading right away when you go back!
Posts.Title: Recalled for Diagnostic Mammogram-help!

Posts.Content: Tenderness after surgery has a lot to do with the location of the incision, the size of the biopsy, and the size of your breast. For example, a large breast can pull on the site of surgery if the incision is in the upper part of the breast. Wearing a sports bra 24/7 may help. Just be sure to see your doctor if you have any signs of infection---redness or increased temp in the breast. Hope things turned out ok!
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy info needed
